title: Solon Solon (C.630-C.560 BC) was an Athenian statesman and lawgiver, noted for his economic, constitutional, and legal reforms. He was one of the supposed SEVEN SAGES OF GREECE. A wise statesman can be described as a Solon

generally regarded as a monumental work of literature as well as historical analysis.
